posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'm kicking this one off on a long in-drawn breath. Oddly enough, I've had some time on my hands lately, and my bloody stupid brain kept going back to my somewhat shambolic attempt at constructing the beloved Drow Cleric, Viconia DeVir (of Baldur's Gate renown). Here's the full sorry tale... Viconia

I think I let her down and went for softer options than I should have done. She deserves better, and hopefully the Guild can help me with that. This time I'm going full-blown caster Cleric with buckets of offensive spells, and maybe a smattering of Zen Archery. If there's any second/third class involved, I'm not having any xp penalty (it's one of my unwritten rules), so they'd have to be either prestige classes or Wizard. My current thinking is to only bolt a few Assassin levels on for the skills (like Tumble and UMD) and a bit of Sneak Attack, but am amenable to other suggestions, although she will be Evil this time - or indeed going full Cleric.

Now, you all know Stag doesn't do casters, so I am going to need nursing through all this malarkey, but I do want to get her right. I put my faith in you good people...

Thanks in advance for helping me remedy a grievous mistake.

Cheers

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
It looks like Viconia is a dex / wis neutral evil drow Cleric 
In terms of second classes, assassin is a great idea and fits with lore, adds some power with skills and uncanny dodge (2+) to protect dex AC in some awesome drow scale mail perhaps, or even cleric robes. Sneak damage is great, which when added to darkfire, GMW +5, divine favor and str damage from divine power should help.

RE third class for Viconia. Shadowdancer looks like the best of the bunch for the third class for HiPS,  would require you to take dodge and mobility. Wizard 1 might be interesting for the ability to scribe scrolls, although in single player this is not attractive due to the exp costs. I wouldn't choose Blackguard due to the 13 strength + power attack/cleave requirement, although that could be interesting.
I like a Cleric 32 / Assassin 7 / SD 1 idea perhaps, Cleric 29 / Assassin 9 / SD 2 gets evasion, uncanny dodge, 4d6 sneak, HiPS, additional improved invisibility / day, 3 epic cleric bonus feats. 
For two classes maybe Cleric 35 / Assassin 5, Cleric 32 / Assassin 8, Cleric 29 / Assassin 11 depending on the number of skill dumps you want and how much sneak you want with only two classes. 

With the primary stat it sounds like Wisdom is the choice. Dex you can put to 16 or 18 perhaps, Int 14 to 16 for skill points. Str / Cha could be 10 perhaps. 
Then domains should be decided on. Here's a table from the Wiki which helps. I think Trickery fits well for her. There is one other domain to choose. Travel makes sense so you can cast the Web spell (she is a drow) as well as (extended) haste :). Evil sounds cool. Death as well. Animal is always good for empowered summons + cats. War as well.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Many thanks, Orion.

One particularly annoying thing with building Viconia is that as a Drow she's supposed to have innate spell resistance (65% in BG2, iirc), which would seem to point her towards a heavy investment in Monk, but I don't the levels to spare, given that she's also the strongest caster Cleric in the game. A level or 2 in SD sounds quite appropriate, given that Shar is goddess of night and loss (she was expelled from Lolth's service and adopted by Shar), so there's a certain appeal to the Trickery domain as well - or would that be over-egging things with HiPS as well? Then there's the issue of feats. If I go SD I'll need 2 of my 7 pre-epics to qualify for the class, which doesn't give much wiggle-room assuming I take Zen Archery, Extend, Empower, and at least one of Still and Silent.

And that's where I really start getting frazzled by the class: which domains to take? In Vicky's case, Death, Destruction, Evil, Strength, Travel, Trickery, Strength, and War all seem fitting, so how to discriminate?

But hey-ho, I've set my feet on this road to hell now, best just keep going...

Cheers

posts.content: I'd probably choose Trickery and War in Viconia's case but I guess you can have a look at each domain with corresponding information in the table and see what fits and what is most enjoyable, then what doesn't fit and isn't fun. I wouldn't choose Evil for example I don't want to use my spell slots for negative energy burst for example, and turning outsiders doesn't quite fit in my mind etc etc it doesn't seem fun to me but maybe thats just me

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Alright, I'll buy it - Trickery and War it is (and I promise no blame shall fall your way should I make a hash of it).

On to my next question: I know I mentioned the feats before, but I'd forgotten about the potential for the Spell Focus line. Would I be missing out on too much if I took (in no particular order) Zen Archery, Extend, Empower, Silent or Still, Spell Focus and its big brother? That would leave one left for either Blind Fight or a Weapon Focus (could be either crossbow as Cleric, or longbow as Elf). And if I do go down the SF route, it's a question of which bloody school? My first temptations are Evocation or Necromancy.

Told you I'd need some nursing in this, sorry.

Cheers

EDIT: Oh, and I also forgot about Max Spell. Aargh!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You want EVO because Clerics have better spells there, rather than NECRO, although if you could take both that would be ideal.

Namely, you want EVO first, because of these spells:
Hammer of the gods -> https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Hammer_of_the_gods
Sunbeam -> https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Sunbeam
Implosion -> https://nwn.fandom.com/wiki/Implosion

Do notice that these three spells have all different saving throws category (will, reflex & fortitude) & none of them are stopped by deathward.
As an additional bonus, all three of them are AoE, meaning dooming many foes with a single spell.
Of course, searing light & flame strike are also evocations, but that's secondary.
Clerics have the best spell DCs (48) in the game, because of Implosion's implementation in Neverwinter Nights (+3DC).
Now, add these spells to the already impressive Harm & Word of Faith (NO save) & you can have your cake & eat it too.
